project_abstract.cdata: The Third Education Project will: (a) establish 83 rural community learning centers; (b) complete construction of 77 associated primary schools for 18,000 students which were initiated by community financial effort; (c) provide functional buildings and equipment for workshops and laboratories for five lower secondary schools; (d) expand two existing multilateral secondary schools with workshops and laboratories; (e) provide in-service training for about 2,700 teachers, school directors and supervisiors of project institutions; (f) print materials for the production of 10 textbook titles and related teaching guides; (g) assist the various departments in the Ministry of Education Departments to improve their efficiency in educational administration; (h) help the Ministry of Education complete an educational facilities survey and a school map; (i) assist the Government in carrying out a study on bilingual education; and (j) provide related technical assistance comprising eight man-years of specialist services and 27 man-years of fellowships for training abroad.
